DOC.criteria: 1 . Age > 18 year < 85 year 2 . Vitamin D 25OH level < 20 ng/ml 3 . One follow risk factor : Known coronary artery disease ( CAD ) CAD equivalent ( e.g . diabetes , chronic kidney disease , etc ) BMI > 30 kg/m2 Random Glucose Level > 200mg/dl Increased Waist Circumference ( male : > 40in ; Females : > 35in . ) Decreased HDL ( Male : < 40mg/dl ; Female : < 50mf/dl ) Framingham Risk Score > 10 % hsCRP > 2 mg/L 1 . Serum phosphorus level > 5.5 mg/dl 2 . Estimated GFR < 30 ml/min/1.73m2 3 . Use Vitamin D > 400 IU/day within 1 month recent Vitamin D 25OH determination 4 . Use calcitriol `` activate '' vitamin D 5 . Change statin , ezetimibe , niacin , fibrate dose within 1 month 6 . Concurrent participation investigational drug study 7 . Have condition , opinion investigator , prohibit participation study 8 . Serum calcium level > 10.5 mg/dl 9. antiepileptic medication 10. triglyceride > 400 mg/dL 11 . BMI > 40 kg/m2 12 . Evidence cirrhosis evidence AST > 3 x upper limit , ALT > 3 x upper limit , bilirubin > 1.5 mg/dL , albumin < 3.0 g/dL , PT > 14.5 sec 13 . Pregnant Lactating Females
